alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Leyden, or 8 miles south of Brattleboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Guilford Center, Guilford, Whitingham, Halifax, Jacksonville, North Vernon, Whitneyville, Grove, Harrisville, Packer Corner, West Guilford, Green River, West Halifax, Fairview Village and West Brattleboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
